description: {"blocks":[{"key":"17ib4","text":"This protocol is used for DNA extraction of samples from the tropical plant family Annonaceae for leaves dried using silicagel or sampled from herbarium sheets. This protocol is made for generation of small to long fragments (depending quality of sample) to prepare NGS libraries.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8tdbn","text":"This protocol is designed to extract DNA in  batches of 48 samples, but this can also be undertaken in 2 times 48 (96) samples.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
disclaimer: {"blocks":[{"key":"78c3c","text":"This project has received funding from the European Research Council (ERC) under the European Union’s Horizon 2020 research and innovation program (grant agreement No. 865787)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"a2jem","text":"Work in a clean environment to avoid contamination, use as much as possible filter tips, wear gloves and lab coat. Wash work space and pipettes before and after use, with DNAaway and DNAse away. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7opuq","text":"Manipulate with extreme caution rare or old samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
protocol_references: {"blocks":[{"key":"c91mv","text":"Part of this protol follows:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2t3va","text":"Couvreur TLP, Helmstetter AJ, Koenen EJM, Bethune K, Brandão RD, Little SA, Sauquet H, Erkens RHJ (2019) Phylogenomics of the Major Tropical Plant Family Annonaceae Using Targeted Enrichment of Nuclear Genes. Frontiers in Plant Science 9. https://doi.org/10.3389/fpls.2018.01941\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

related_materials.name: Gel Red Nucleic Acid Gel Stain

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6fig3","text":"Prepare 48 2 mL Screw-Top tubes in rows of 8 in a 96 well rack. Add one 1/4'' ceramic beads (MP Biomedical REF 116540422).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"24sdl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fpk3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"jqsf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2h37s","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ftl8b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"99ad7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"result","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dr1lj","text":"Within the GLOBAL project, around 3600 DNA extractions were undertaken, some on silicagel leaves others on herbarium preserved leaves.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7ve6t","text":"For silicagel dried samples we extracted 1050 specimens, with a max concentration of 979 ng/ul and a minimum of 0.9 ng/ul for a total elution volume of 100 ul. On average we had 213 ng/ul (Standard error: 205.8).","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"d4ej","text":"For herbarium preserved leaves 2600 samples were extracted: the highest concentration was 1088ng/ul and the lowest was 0,1 ng/ul for a total elution volume of 60 ul. On average we had 230 ng/ul per extraction (Standard error: 221.8).","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7sqa6","text":"Concentrations below 10 ng/ul were rarely used to sequenced or frequently failed.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8k70t","text":"DNA size ranged between 100pb-2.5kb, but longer fragments were also possible.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9retr","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5lfk1","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"F9C6D6D0981011ED964D7D5A47C2ADC5"}}}}
